melting.methodInterfaces

Interface SodiumEquivalentMethod

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    Ahsen01_NaEquivalent, Mitsuhashi96NaEquivalent, Peyret00_NaEquivalent, SodiumEquivalent

    public interface SodiumEquivalentMethod
    This interface is implemented by classes which contain a method to compute an equivalent sodium concentration when other ions are present.

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      double computeSodiumEquivalent(double Na, double Mg, double K, double Tris, double dNTP)
      This method is called to convert an initial sodium concentration in a new equivalent sodium concentration which takes in account the other cation concentrations.
      boolean isApplicable(HashMap<String,String> options)
      Check if the model to compute an equivalent sodium cencentration is applicable with the options entered by the user.

    • Method Detail

      • computeSodiumEquivalent

        double computeSodiumEquivalent(double Na,
                             double Mg,
                             double K,
                             double Tris,
                             double dNTP)
        This method is called to convert an initial sodium concentration in a new equivalent sodium concentration which takes in account the other cation concentrations.
        Parameters:
        Na - : sodium concentration entered by the user
        Mg - : magnesium concentration entered by the user
        K - : potassium concentration entered by the user
        Tris - : Tris buffer concentration entered by the user.
        dNTP - : dNTP concentration entered by the user
        Returns:
        double NaEq. It is the equivalent sodium computed concentration

      • isApplicable

        boolean isApplicable(HashMap<String,String> options)
        Check if the model to compute an equivalent sodium cencentration is applicable with the options entered by the user.
        Parameters:
        options - which contains the options. (default options and options entered by the user)
        Returns:
        false if one of the options entered by the user make the model inapplicable. If one of the options can make the results less reliable, a warning message will appear.
